definitions.definition: The time at which something happens.
definitions.example: A good article will cover the who, the what, the when, the where, the why and the how.

definitions.definition: (interrogative) At what time? At which time? Upon which occasion or circumstance? Used to introduce direct or indirect questions about time.
definitions.example: Do you know when they arrived?

definitions.definition: At an earlier time and under different, usually less favorable, circumstances.
definitions.example: He's mister high and mighty now, but I remember him when.

definitions.definition: (relative) At which, on which, during which: often omitted or replaced with that.
definitions.example: That was the day when the Twin Towers fell.
Since when do I need your permission?
I recall when they were called the Greys.

definitions.definition: At (or as soon as) that time that; at the (or any and every) time that; if.
definitions.example: A player wins when [as soon as, or at any time that, if] she has four cards of the same suit.

definitions.definition: During the time that; at the time of the action of the following clause or participle phrase.
definitions.example: Be careful when crossing the street.

definitions.definition: At what time; at which time.
definitions.example: I am here till Friday, when [i.e. at which time] I leave for Senegal.

definitions.definition: Since; given the fact that; considering that.
definitions.example: I don't see the point of putting up Christmas decorations when I am the only person who is going to see them.

definitions.definition: Whereas; although; at the same time as; in spite of the fact that.
definitions.example: He keeps changing things when the existing system works perfectly well.

definitions.definition: That's enough, a command to stop adding something, especially an ingredient of food or drink.
